SALESFORCE HELP

VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Platform Cache: Fine-Tune Performance and Resource Usage

Optimize storefront performance when loading category, product, page labels, and anonymous account data on your pages. Control the precise time to live (TTL) values for each type of B2B Commerce for Visualforce data stored in your org's Platform Cache. To fully customize your solution, you can access and extend new methods in the B2B Commerce for Visualforce API that implement caching.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

How: After you upgrade the managed package and the available global data, the following configuration settings are available under the Platform Cache module:

Category Tree Cache TTL
Category Data Cache TTL
Product Data Cache TTL
Anonymous Account Cache TTL
Page Label Cache TTL

For each setting, enter the TTL (in seconds) for that type of data.

Also, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now uses cached category and product data when loading category and product data, such as on the Product List page. API queries of products and categories also rely on the cached data.

The following global API changes support these enhancements:

The ccrz.ccUtil class includes several methods that generate hash keys for use with the Platform Cache. The methods accept several data types and return an SHA-256 hash of the passed-in object. To fully customize caching behavior in your B2B Commerce for Visualforce, you can extend or override these methods.
The ccrz.ccApi class includes a new flushCache() method, which executes an Apex call to clear the B2B Commerce for Visualforce partition in your org's Platform Cache.
SEE ALSO
Improve Storefront Performance with Platform Cache

(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.ccApi
